Name: Mount Everest
Description: The highest mountain on Earth, located in the Himalayas.

Name: Grand Canyon
Description: A massive canyon carved by the Colorado River in Arizona, USA.

Name: Amazon River
Description: The second longest river in the world, flowing through South America.

Name: Great Barrier Reef
Description: The world s largest coral reef system, located in Australia.

Name: Sahara Desert
Description: The largest hot desert in the world, covering much of North Africa.

Name: Niagara Falls
Description: A famous group of waterfalls on the border of the USA and Canada.

Name: Lake Baikal
Description: The world s deepest freshwater lake, located in Russia.

Name: Victoria Falls
Description: One of the largest and most famous waterfalls in the world, located in Africa.

Name: Rocky Mountains
Description: A major mountain range in North America.

Name: Mount Fuji
Description: An iconic volcano and the highest mountain in Japan.

Name: Yosemite Valley
Description: A famous glacial valley in Yosemite National Park, USA.

Name: Gobi Desert
Description: A vast desert in Asia, covering parts of China and Mongolia.

Name: Angel Falls
Description: The world s highest uninterrupted waterfall, located in Venezuela.

Name: Mount Kilimanjaro
Description: Africa s highest mountain and a dormant volcano in Tanzania.

Name: Mississippi River
Description: One of the longest rivers in North America.

Name: Dead Sea
Description: A hypersaline lake bordered by Jordan and Israel, known for its high salt content.

Name: Mount McKinley (Denali)
Description: The highest peak in North America, located in Alaska.

Name: Krubera Cave
Description: The deepest known cave on Earth, located in Georgia (Caucasus).

Name: Patagonia
Description: A rugged region in South America, famous for glaciers and mountains.

Name: Great Lakes
Description: A group of five large freshwater lakes in North America.

Name: Blue Hole
Description: A giant marine sinkhole off the coast of Belize.

Name: Mariana Trench
Description: The deepest part of the world s oceans, located in the Pacific Ocean.

Name: Table Mountain
Description: A flat-topped mountain in South Africa, overlooking Cape Town.

Name: Uluru (Ayers Rock)
Description: A massive sandstone monolith in central Australia.

Name: Antarctic Ice Sheet
Description: The world s largest single mass of ice, covering Antarctica.

Name: Matterhorn
Description: A famous pyramidal mountain in the Alps, on the border of Switzerland and Italy.

Name: Yellowstone Caldera
Description: A supervolcano in Yellowstone National Park, USA.

Name: Lake Titicaca
Description: The highest navigable lake in the world, located in South America.

Name: Mount Etna
Description: Europe s highest and most active volcano, located in Italy.

Name: Ha Long Bay
Description: A stunning bay in Vietnam, known for its limestone islands.

Name: Danube River
Description: A major river in Europe, flowing through multiple countries.

Name: Mount St. Helens
Description: A well-known volcano in the USA that erupted in 1980.

Name: Iguazu Falls
Description: A large and stunning waterfall system on the Argentina-Brazil border.

Name: Mount Vesuvius
Description: A volcano in Italy that famously destroyed Pompeii in AD 79.

Name: Atacama Desert
Description: One of the driest deserts in the world, located in South America.

Name: N/A
Description: N/A
